thread.title: Millburn High School varsity girls tennis team advances to Group 3 final
thread.title_full: Millburn High School varsity girls tennis team advances to Group 3 final

title: Millburn High School varsity girls tennis team advances to Group 3 final
text:
Millburn High School varsity girls tennis team advances to Group 3 final October 15, 2015 Last updated: Thursday, October 15, 2015, 11:48 AM By Jim Connelly staff photo by jim connelly 
It's on to the state group finals for Millburn High School's varsity girls tennis team. 
The Millers, the North Jersey, Section 2 champion, dispatched North Jersey, Section 1 titlist Northern Highlands Regional High School 5-0 this morning in the New Jersey State Interscholastic Athletic Association Group 3 semifinals at Mercer County Park in West Windsor. 
Millburn will go after a 10th consecutive state group crown this afternoon at 1 o'clock against Central Jersey champion Moorestown High School. Moorestown advanced with a defeat of South Jersey winner Mainland Regional High School in this morning's other semifinal. 
Stephanie Schrage staked Millburn to a 1-0 lead with a 6-0, 6-0 win at first singles against Madison Hite. 
Alex Pritsker made the score 2-0 with a 6-0, 6-1 defeat of Charlotte Hagan at second singles. 
The second doubles team of Elizabeth Gray and Anna Mandel provided the match clinching point. 
Gray and Mandel defeated Gabi Tantillo and Anna Rimland 6-2, 6-2. 
Isabella Waung and Sydney Zirlin extended the lead to 4-0 with a 6-1, 6-3 defeat of Chloe Decker and Sarah Apsey at first doubles. 
Joanna Atwater completed the shutout with a 6-2, 6-3 defeat of Emily Hite at third singles. 
The Millers are seeking to claim a 10th straight group crown and move within one of Red Bank Catholic High School's state record for consecutive group titles. 
Millburn reeled off six straight Group 3 crowns from 2006 through 2011. The Millers, after moving up a group, claimed Group 4 crowns in 2012 and 2013. 
The Millers capped a return to Group 3 last season with a defeat of Princeton High School in the title match. 
Email: connellyj@northjersey.com
